item.title: Ferrovial's Heathrow Stake Price Should Be Well Received, Jefferies Says
item.description: Ferrovial’s divestment of its stake in Heathrow Airport was expected, and the transaction price of £2.37 billion should be well received, Jefferies said, adding the market’s focus will now likely turn to how the funds will be used.

item.title: Bond Markets Expected to Celebrate if German Inflation Falls
item.description: Germany’s inflation rate is making great strides toward the ECB’s 2% target, and if Wednesday’s data underpin this, bond markets are likely to celebrate, DZ Bank Research said.

item.title: Deliveroo Targets Stronger Long-Term Growth
item.description: Deliveroo set out a plan to grow gross transaction value in the mid-teens percentage a year over the longer term, and said it aimed to hit an adjusted underlying earnings margin of 4% by 2026.

item.title: CNH Strengthens Amid USD Weakness, PBOC's Forex Policy Support
item.description: CNH strengthened amid USD weakness and the PBOC’s forex policy support.

item.title: Ferrovial Sells Stake in Heathrow Airport
item.description: Ferrovial said Saudi Arabia’s wealth fund and private-equity group Ardian would pay $3 billion to acquire a 25% stake in the airport.

item.title: Brookfield's Origin Saga Shows It's Hard to Price Polluters --- Analysis
item.description: At the heart of a nearly US$11 billion takeover tussle for the owner of several Australian coal-fired power plants is a key question for investors: how to value a major polluter that could also become a big enabler of the energy transition.

item.title: An elevator plunge in a decades-old shaft killed 11 miners and injured 75 others at South Africa's largest platinum mine.
item.description: An elevator plunge in a decades-old shaft killed 11 miners and injured 75 others at South Africa’s largest platinum mine.

item.title: Rescuers freed the 41 construction workers sealed inside a mountain tunnel in northern Indiaby a landslide for over two weeks.
item.description: Rescuers freed the 41 construction workers sealed inside a mountain tunnel in northern India by a landslide for over two weeks.

item.title: A U.K. regulator found Adobe's planned $20 billion acquisition of Figma would likely harm innovation for software used by the vast majority of U.K. digital designers.
item.description: A U.K. regulator found Adobe’s planned $20 billion acquisition of Figma would likely harm innovation for software used by the vast majority of U.K. digital designers.

item.title: A law designed to protect patients from surprise medical bills is contributing to the financial distress of some medical-service providers.
item.description: A law designed to protect patients from surprise medical bills is contributing to the financial distress of some medical-service providers.

item.title: American Airlines is joining the race to remove carbon from the atmosphere, tapping a novel method that is much cheaper than many existing approaches.
item.description: American Airlines is joining the race to remove carbon from the atmosphere, tapping a novel method that is much cheaper than many existing approaches.

item.title: U.S. companies have lost momentum in promoting Black professionals into management, according to new data from McKinsey.
item.description: U.S. companies have lost momentum in promoting Black professionals into management, according to new data from McKinsey.

item.title: Died: Charlie Munger, 99, business partner of Buffett.
item.description: Died: Charlie Munger, 99, business partner of Buffett.

item.title: Ukraine said the wife of one of its top military leaders was poisoned, raising suspicion in Kyiv that she was the victim of an assassination attempt.
item.description: Ukraine said the wife of one of its top military leaders was poisoned, raising suspicion in Kyiv that she was the victim of an assassination attempt.

item.title: The U.S. is pressing Israel to modify its plans for the next phase of its campaign in Gaza to better protect civilians and rebut criticism that the White House has given Israel carte blanche to wage its war with Hamas.
item.description: The U.S. is pressing Israel to modify its plans for the next phase of its campaign in Gaza to better protect civilians and rebut criticism that the White House has given Israel carte blanche to wage its war with Hamas.

item.title: A Russian courtruled to extended the detention of WSJ reporterEvan Gershkovichfor a third time.
item.description: A Russian court ruled to extended the detention of WSJ reporter Evan Gershkovich for a third time.

item.title: Disney's Iger told employees that the task he faced after returning to the company was harder than expected, and he played down his previous comments suggesting major asset sales were on the table.
item.description: Disney’s Iger told employees that the task he faced after returning to the company was harder than expected, and he played down his previous comments suggesting major asset sales were on the table.

item.title: The S&P 500 edged higher Tuesday, gaining 0.1%. The Nasdaq and Dow added 0.3% and 0.2%, respectively.
item.description: The S&P 500 edged higher Tuesday, gaining 0.1%. The Nasdaq and Dow added 0.3% and 0.2%, respectively.

item.title: Home prices climbed to a record in September due to a shortage of houses for sale, even as high mortgage rates made home purchases less affordable.
item.description: Home prices climbed to a record in September due to a shortage of houses for sale, even as high mortgage rates made home purchases less affordable.

item.title: Apple is pulling the plug on its credit-card partnership with Goldman Sachs, ending the Wall Street bank's bid to expand into consumer lending.
item.description: Apple is pulling the plug on its credit-card partnership with Goldman Sachs, ending the Wall Street bank’s bid to expand into consumer lending.
